meanings.definition: Having or covered with small, rounded protuberances
meanings.sent1: The leaf was papillate, with tiny bumps all over.
meanings.sent2: Her skin felt papillate, like sandpaper to the touch.
meanings.sent3: The cat's tongue was so papillate that it tickled when it licked you.
meanings.sent4: The rough road was papillate with gravel, causing the tires to rumble.
meanings.sent5: The strawberry was papillate, each seed a small bump bursting with flavor.

meanings.definition: To have or form small, rounded protuberances
meanings.sent1: Over time, the metal will papillate, creating a textured surface.
meanings.sent2: The skin can papillate when exposed to extreme temperatures.
meanings.sent3: The cake began to papillate as it cooled, forming a unique pattern on top.
meanings.sent4: The tree bark will papillate as it ages, developing a rough exterior.
meanings.sent5: The paint will papillate if not stirred properly, leading to a bumpy finish.
